result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt Lee Drexler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kurt Lee Drexler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kurt Lee Drexler was found guilty of Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurt Lee Drexler

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kurt Lee Drexler in court, via video from New Lisbon Correctional, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 00CF13 & 15CF22.  Called at 9:02 am.   Def's motion.   Arguments presented by Mr. Drexler to support his motion.  Response by Atty Gebert,  requesting motion be denied.   Court has questions of money being withheld from def.  Response by Mr. Drexler.  Additional arguments by Mr. Drexlelr.  Court makes the following decision  00CF13 - Court ordered civil judgment on this case, since this was sentencing after revocation.  Civil judgment was entered as ordered.  Court does not have proof of any over payment towards obligations.   Court will reserve right for def to review.  15CF22 - JOC does not state that cost can not be collected while confined.  Court will denied motion for both cases.
from def  -see 00CF13

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Enforce Judgment of Conviction and/or Motion to Withdraw Plea.   Attached Documents
of Proceedings.  Sentence Hearing on Revocation; Plea and Sentencing held October 29, 2015

Defendant Kurt Lee Drexler in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Kurt Lee Drexler in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF22 and 00CF13 @ 3:07 p.m. 00CF13 is sentence after revocation, will do plea on 15CF22 first then sentencing on both. State had made offer, but no agreement at this time except that 15CF22 Def will plea to ct 1 and ct 2 will be dismissed, both sides free to argue. Statement by DA. Response by Atty Cirilli. Plea quest. reviewed. Prelim hrg rights reviewed. Court finds waiver freely & voluntarily made, finds probable cause. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived. Plea to 15CF22 ct 1 - no contest. Ct 2 dismissed on motion of State. Constitutional rights, elements and penalties reviewed. Atty Cirilli satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely and voluntarily made. Factual basis stipulated. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 sex registry violation. Sentencing arguments by Counsel on both cases. State asks for 20 yrs prison, 15 yrs initial confinement, 5 yrs ext supv, w/529 days credit for time served. On 15CF22 State asks for 6 yrs prison, 3 yrs initial confinement, 3 yrs extended supervision, concurrent to revocation. State advises not eligible for  programs. Statement by the Court, has reviewed revocation summary. State has no additions or corrections. Arguments by Atty Cirilli. Atty Cirilli recites Def's changes/corrections to revocation summary for the record. Response by State. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. 15CF22 ct 1 - No DNA sample or surcharge. 15CF22 - 266 days credit for time served  00CF13 - credit for 529 days served. Sentences will be concurrent. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. 00CF13 - convert any outstanding financial obligations to civil judgment, reserve Def's right to hrg on amt. 15CF22 - court costs to be paid as condition of extended supervision. Court finds Def not eligible for challenge inc. or earned release programs. Court will follow rev. summary recommendation. 00CF13 ct 1 - 15 yrs prison, 10 yrs init. conf. 5 yrs ext supv. Ct 2 - 15 yrs prison, 10 yrs init conf. 5 yrs ext supv. concurrent to ct 1. 15CF22 ct 1 - 2 yrs prison, 1 yr init conf., 1 yr ext supv, concurrent to 00CF13. Postconviction rights. Adjourn 4:32 p.m.

Defendant Kurt Lee Drexler in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Kurt Lee Drexler in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF22 and 00CF13 @ 1:50 p.m.  Was scheduled for plea/sentencing and sent. after revocation. Court was advised of status prior to going on the record and summarizes for the record. Court will grant adjournment. Off the record for scheduling. Back on the record. Both cases rescheduled for 10/29/15 @ 3:00 p.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-23-2015 01:30 pm
Copy to parties 6-2-15

Defendant Kurt Lee Drexler not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file.  State request warrant.  Court will authorize warrant, $2000. bond or body

Defendant Kurt Lee Drexler in court, vai video in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews charges with possible penalties. Def advised of right to an atty.  Def has contacted an atty, needs time to post retainer fee.  Def wishes to enter plea of not guilty.  Court advises def that this is felony charge.  Right to preliminary hearing within 20 days.    Time limits for preliminary waived.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
